This really is a very good app for learning Japanese and should definitely be used by anyone wanting to learn Japanese. What sets it apart from Duolingo is that it teaches the "why" of it all as you go, giving context to things like the particles and how to draw the characters, as well as insights into the evolution of the language and Japanese culture. What also sets it apart from Duolingo though is that it doesn't drill you on the things you have learned in each lesson, just a short quiz at the end. The primary area where I found this a problem was in learning the hiragana and katakana characters, those really need to be drilled to stick. Pair it with the first few lessons of Japanese on Duolingo and perhaps a couple of the kana practice apps though and you've got an incredibly well rounded process for learning Japanese. If you try the Lite version and decide to switch, know that your progress doesn't carry over to the new app, so I recommend switching sooner than later.

Apologies in advance for the wall of text, but Google Play reviews don't like paragraph breaks.  Excellent app overall.  The vocabulary and sentence structure bits are well done, being comprehensive as well as comprehensible.  I can't comment much on the kana learning bits, as I'd learned kana before diving into the app, but they seem to cover everything.  You'll probably want paper worksheets or another app to practice your writing, though.  There are three ways in which I can see the app being improved.  If the devs improve it in the first two ways I suggest, I'll add a star to my rating.  First, a method for saving progress across devices would be ideal.  Like many people, I use multiple devices, but there is no apparent way to move progress stats between them.  Either a cloud save option or ability to export/import progress would work.  Second, please support portrait mode.  Landscape mode is fine for tablets, but when I'm using the app on the go, such as on public transit, it's inconvenient to use it two-handed.  Lastly, and this is a minor issue that doesn't affect my rating, please support the Samsung multi-window mode if possible.
